The theory of general relativity has had a profound impact on our understanding of the universe, and it has led to many important scientific and technological advancements. It has been tested and confirmed by numerous observations and experiments, and it remains one of the cornerstones of modern physics.
In summary, according to Einstein himself, the only truly revolutionary thing he did was to develop the theory of general relativity, which challenged the long-held beliefs about space, time, and gravity, and led to a fundamental shift in our understanding of the universe.

He argued that the value of a good or service is not determined by its inherent qualities, but rather by the desire of individuals to possess it.
